locale.message: Generates a SSHRC Report for journals.

With this plugin enabled, journal managers may generate reports for the Social Science and Humanities (SSHRC) Aid to Scholarly Journals program. This report does not generate a complete, ready-to-go application for SSHRC, but will automatically retrieve and bundle information already included in OJS, along with the information provided below, into one single report that can subsequently be used to assist in writing the SSHRC application. For more information on eligibility and other guidelines, see the SSHRC website.

Once you configure the plugin, you can retrieve the report from the Stats and Reports page, from your Journal Management pages.

Note: While this plugin aims to provide as much relevant information from OJS as possible for your SSHRC reporting needs, this information should only be used as a starting point for your application. The information provided by this plugin should be referenced against and supplemented by all other sources of information available to the journal, including external subscriber databases; Google Analytics or Piwik Analytics (provided you have the relevant generic plugins enabled); and other indexing and impact sources.

OJS already includes a substantial amount of information that maybe be of use in your SSHRC application. Select the items below that are relevant to your application, and ensure that you have fully configured each option by following the links below.

While many elements that SSHRC requests are available directly from the OJS system itself, SSHRC also requests the following information that is not typically stored within OJS. Please fill these out to the best of your ability. You may have to revisit these items from year to year.

Measures of Impact:
Include any viable measures of impact, including citation index information or available impact factors, that may be pertinent; or provide a self-evaluation of the journal's impact

Editor-in-chief's Research Record:
Provide a comprehensive description of the editor-in-chief's record of research and scholarly achievement

Editorial Board Description:
Please describe the functioning of your editorial board

Subscription Information:
This report provides the information available under Subscriptions. If you wish to clarify your subscription policies, or add any further information to be considered, please do so here
